statement:
Every prime element of an integral domain is irreducible.

Let $D$ be an integral domain, and let $a\in D$ be a prime element.
Assume $a=bc$ for some $b,c\in D$.

Clearly ${{a}\mid{bc}}$, so since $a$ is prime, ${{a}\mid{b}}$ or
${{a}\mid{c}}$. Without loss of generality, assume ${{a}\mid{b}}$, and
say $at=b$ for some $t\in D$.

If $1$ is the unity of $D$, then $$1b=b=at=(bc)t=b(ct)
.$$ Since $D$ is an integral domain, $b$ can be cancelled, giving
$1=ct$, so $c$ is a unit.
names: prime element is irreducible in integral domain
